context: Insurance company evaluating expansion of cyber liability product line in response to increasing cyber threats and regulatory requirements

request.purpose: Development of expanded cyber liability product suite including parametric cyber insurance, cyber extortion coverage, and supply chain risk protection
request.justification: Cyber incidents increased 300% in past 3 years, new EU cybersecurity regulations require specialized coverage, market demand for comprehensive cyber protection

decision_process.outcome: Identified 40% market gap in parametric cyber products, strong customer demand for supply chain coverage
Developed 5 new product variants with projected 25% profit margin

business_impact.expected_outcome: 30% increase in cyber insurance premium revenue, market leadership in parametric cyber products, improved risk diversification
business_impact.projected_value: $12,500,000 in additional annual premiums within 3 years

outcome_tracking.6_month_review: 3 new products launched, $2.1M in new premiums written
outcome_tracking.12_month_review: Premium growth of 35%, market share increased by 12%, claims experience within expected ranges

lessons_learned: Parametric products require sophisticated modeling but offer faster claims settlement, customer education critical for complex cyber products, regulatory compliance adds value proposition
